snippet: The Constitutional Court said Tuesday that it had upheld a law requiring nongovernmental organizations that engage in political activity and receive funds from abroad to register as foreign agents.
abstract: Russia's Constitutional Court upholds law requiring nongovernmental organizations that engage in political activity and receive funds from abroad to register as foreign agents.
lead_paragraph: The Constitutional Court said Tuesday that it had upheld a law requiring nongovernmental organizations that engage in political activity and receive funds from abroad to register as foreign agents.
